meanings.definition: To launch or initiate before the official launch date or time.
meanings.sent1: The company prelaunches their new product to build excitement.
meanings.sent2: She prelaunches her online store to test customer interest.
meanings.sent3: The cat prelaunches its pounce on the unsuspecting toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The sun prelaunches its rays over the horizon, signaling a new day.
meanings.sent5: The chef prelaunches the dessert by revealing the secret ingredient.

meanings.definition: The act of launching or initiating before the official launch date or time.
meanings.sent1: The prelaunches of the spacecraft were successful.
meanings.sent2: Attendees eagerly awaited the prelaunches of the event.
meanings.sent3: The prelaunches of the party decorations surprised the guests.
meanings.sent4: The prelaunches of the movie trailers captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The prelaunches of the book series created a buzz among readers.
